{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3342963,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T18:01:30.025Z","cooked":"

My team has been using limelight for the past two years and has had nothing but problems with their lack of proper documentation and poor community support (in our experience) so we would like to switch to photonvision, i know you can image a limelight to work with PV but is that a good decision? or is something like an orange PI better?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T18:01:30.025Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":67.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460049,"topic_slug":"switching-to-photonvision","display_username":"Falon Clark","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57393,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The Kotlin Guy"},"post_url":"/t/switching-to-photonvision/460049/1","custom_user_title":"The Kotlin Guy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3342966,"name":"","username":"Akash_Rastogi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/akash_rastogi/{size}/169937_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T18:04:36.738Z","cooked":"

Can you expand on what you need help with regarding your limelight? Which LL are you using? For apriltags or for object detection?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T18:04:36.738Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":460049,"topic_slug":"switching-to-photonvision","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8002,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty"},"post_url":"/t/switching-to-photonvision/460049/2","custom_user_title":"177 & 429 | #TeamWCP| #TeamThrifty","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342970,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T18:06:54.318Z","cooked":"

To tack on…

It’s not a bad decision per say, but a lot of teams have indeed had success with limelight. It would be a bit surprising if the issues your team had were unresolvable. Still, I can understand the desire to get to a solution with the least effort.

The software will look and work very similarly regardless of hardware. Trying out on the hardware you have first is the path I’d recommend, then decide if it actually solves your issues, and if you want more performance and will go get some updated hardware.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-03-25T18:07:31.582Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460049,"topic_slug":"switching-to-photonvision","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/switching-to-photonvision/460049/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3342992,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-25T18:19:34.413Z","cooked":"

Im sure we could work it out over time, but the fact of the matter is that closed source software with bad docs is much harder to use than open source software with bad docs (not that PV has bad docs)

For AprilTag detection, imaging the Limelight with PV is a viable solution and goes a long way. I have read that an Orange Pi is commonly used for object detection.

Good luck!

My team uses an Orange Pi 5 for our PV stuff, and its worked really well. We run both an april tag camera and a object detection camera at the same time without any performance issues. Another big bonus of using an Orange Pi 5 is not only a smaller footprint where the camera is, but you can use a better camera, that can get higher resolutions at higher frame rates, global shutter, whatever you want.
